title: Bullfighter survives three cardiac arrests after being gored by bull
text:
A Bullfighter nearly died after being gored at a show in Zaragoza, Spain

A matador tore his rectum, groin and bladder after being attacked by a bull during a show in the Spanish city of Zaragoza.

Bullfighter Mariano De la Viña say it is a ‘miracle’ that he is still alive after reportedly suffering three cardiac arrests because of the severity of the injuries he received in the Plaza de Toros.

He was performing at the El Pilar fair when he was charged by a bull which knocked him to the floor, gored him, lifted him into the air and dragged him across the bullring before attacking him a second time.

He suffered a 27 centimetre wound through his groin which severed his femoral artery, and another 22 centimetre wound between his rectum and bladder, tearing another vital artery.

Mariano de la Vina is charged by a bull during a bullfight of the El Pilar Fair (Picture: EPA)

The bull attacked him twice, tearing his rectum and bladder (Picture: EPA)

His injuries were so severe that his surgeon described the situation as ‘cataclysmic’ (Picture: EPA)

His injuries were so severe that his surgeon described the situation as ‘cataclysmic’ and said every hour would count towards his survival chances.

Surgeons at the bullring’s infirmary and a private hospital in Zaragoza have been hailed for performing two lengthy operations which saved the bullfighter’s life.

Dr. Carlos Val-Carreres, chief surgeon of the infirmary of the bullring of Zaragoza, told the bullfighting newspaper Mundotor: ‘We have saved the life of Mariano De la Viña in the first instance but it is still very serious.

‘He is in the Intensive Care Unit of the Quirónsalud Zaragoza Hospital, with the latest bulletin confirming.

Mariano De la Via says its a miracle he is alive (Picture: http://www.toreoyarte.com)

‘He is stable but very serious. After sedation withdrawal, the patient’s neurological response begins to be positive. Circulation is good in his right leg.’
